item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, April 29, 2025 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. O3 beats a master-level GeoGuessr player, even with fake EXIF data (220 points | 139 comments)
2. I made my AI think harder by making it argue with itself. It works stupidly well (140 points | 54 comments)
3. Bamba: An open-source LLM that crosses a transformer with an SSM (55 points | 11 comments)
4. Everything we announced at our first-ever LlamaCon (52 points | 22 comments)
5. ArkFlow: High-performance Rust stream processing engine (100 points | 20 comments)
6. LibreLingo – FOSS Alternative to Duolingo (610 points | 273 comments)
7. Performance optimization is hard because it's fundamentally a brute-force task (165 points | 71 comments)
8. Programming languages should have a tree traversal primitive (121 points | 100 comments)
9. Indian court orders blocking of Proton Mail (126 points | 50 comments)
10. Hestus, Inc. (YC S24) Is Hiring an ML Engineer to Revolutionize CAD ( | hide)
11. Show HN: A Chrome extension that will auto-reject non-essential cookies (161 points | 111 comments)
12. Firefox tab groups are here (279 points | 202 comments)
13. Show HN: Beatsync – perfect audio sync across multiple devices (19 points | 5 comments)
14. Qwen3: Think deeper, act faster (801 points | 363 comments)
15. Show HN: Flowcode – Turing-complete visual programming platform (140 points | 62 comments)
16. A single line of code cost $8000 (236 points | 307 comments)
17. Gaussian Splatting Meets ROS2 (42 points | 11 comments)
18. Why did Windows 7 log on slower for months if you had a solid color background? (463 points | 250 comments)
19. Try Switching to Kagi (450 points | 317 comments)
20. How to build Intrinsic Motivation: a review of the science (91 points | 17 comments)
21. Beyond Performance: Measuring the Environmental Impact of Analytical Databases (3 points | discuss)
22. Generative AI is not replacing jobs or hurting wages at all, say economists (285 points | 403 comments)
23. The One-Person Framework in Practice (341 points | 135 comments)
24. Meta AI App built with Llama 4 (73 points | 86 comments)
25. Oklahoma City family traumatized after ICE mistakenly raids their home (12 points | 3 comments)
26. Heart disease deaths worldwide linked to chemical widely used in plastics (185 points | 106 comments)
27. Pyrefly - A faster Python type checker written in Rust (102 points | 58 comments)
28. One-sixth of the planet's cropland has toxic levels of one or more metals (60 points | 40 comments)
29. One Million Chessboards (318 points | 58 comments)
30. After 53 years, a failed Soviet Venus spacecraft is crashing back to Earth (108 points | 38 comments)
